messages.content:
As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: DETROIT POLICE DEPARTMENT
CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION SECTION
Narcotics Division
SIGNAL: 52N
ITEM NUMBER: N-52067-15
PAGE 9 of 37
CASE SUPERVISORS:
Lt. Harold Jenkins
Sgt. Emily Watson
CASE INVESTIGATOR:
Det. Carl Franklin
ASSISTING DETECTIVES:
Sgt. Lucas Moore
Sgt. Rebecca Scott
( Cyber Crimes Unit)
Det. Adrian Kelly
Det. Natalie Turner
( Cyber Crimes Unit)
Det. Owen Murphy
( Cyber Crimes Unit)
Det. Sarah Lopez
Det. Marcus Young
(General Assignment)
Det. Julia Carter
(Intelligence Unit)
Det. Michael Barnes
(Counterterrorism Section)
VICTIM:
JANE DOE, female, unidentified.
DATE, TIME, and
LOCATION of OFFENSE:
18 AUGUST 2015 at approximately 2:00 AM on Gratiot Avenue.
REPORTING OFFICER:
BADGE:
Det. Carl Franklin
3178
The case evolved with numerous conflicting testimonies and unclear surveillance data. Officer Martinez, on night watch, was among the initial responders at the site. Together with Sgt. Lucas Moore and Patrol Officer Davis, they managed to secure the perimeter. Technician Wright, specializing in digital evidence analysis, was assigned to decode the murky surveillance footage. Criminalist Thompson, sifting through the collected evidence, located a distinctive ring that later became key in identifying a person of interest. Coroner Dr. Harris was summoned to examine an unidentified body found near the scene, initially thought to be unrelated but later proved critical to the narcotics investigation. Patrol Officer Reed, engaging with local residents, unraveled insights leading towards a significant drug operation.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Lt. Harold Jenkins Officer Context: Supervised the narcotics case. Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Sgt. Emily Watson Officer Context: Co-supervisor with Lt. Jenkins. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Det. Carl Franklin Officer Context: Lead investigator for the case, also served as the reporting officer. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Sgt. Lucas Moore Officer Context: Assisted at the scene, part of the Cyber Crimes Unit. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sgt. Rebecca Scott Officer Context: Cyber Crimes Unit sergeant, supported the investigation. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Det. Adrian Kelly Officer Context: Cyber Crimes Unit detective, contributed to the case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Natalie Turner Officer Context: Involved in the case, from the Cyber Crimes Unit. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Owen Murphy Officer Context: Cyber Crimes Unit detective, assisted in the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Sarah Lopez Officer Context: General assignment detective, part of the investigative team. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Marcus Young Officer Context: Assisted in the narcotics case, a General Assignment detective. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Julia Carter Officer Context: Intelligence Unit detective, contributed to the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Michael Barnes Officer Context: Part of the Counterterrorism Section, involved in the case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Officer Martinez Officer Context: One of the initial responders to the crime scene on night watch. Officer Role: Patrolling Officer Officer Name: Patrol Officer Davis Officer Context: Assisted in securing the perimeter at the crime scene. Officer Role: Patrol Officer Officer Name: Technician Wright Officer Context: Specialized in digital evidence analysis, worked on surveillance footage. Officer Role: Forensic Technician Officer Name: Criminalist Thompson Officer Context: Found a distinctive ring in the evidence, crucial for the case. Officer Role: Criminalist Officer Name: Coroner Dr. Harris Officer Context: Examined an unidentified body linked to the investigation. Officer Role: Medical Examiner Officer Name: Patrol Officer Reed Officer Context: Gathered insights from local residents, uncovered a drug operation. Officer Role: Community Relations Officer
